summary: The Farmers Undertake Environmental Land Stewardship Act (FUELS Act) amends the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 concerning the application of the Spill Prevention, Control, and Countermeasure rule to farms. The bill modifies storage capacity thresholds related to spill prevention, increasing the applicability for some farms while excluding others. It also adjusts the gallon limits pertaining to discharge regulations. The overall intent is to refine environmental regulations impacting agricultural practices.
